description: Neuroscience is one of the fastest-growing fields in the sciences, with research interests ranging from molecular genetics to whole animal behavior. Topics include membrane biophysics, synaptic transmission and plasticity, intracellular signaling, sensory transduction, motor control systems, and development. Counts towards the biology and psychology majors. Prerequisite: Biology 125 or Integrated Chemistry/Biology 127. Offered annually, usually in the spring semester.
name: Cell/Molec Neuroscience
notes: Students in Neuro 239 must also register for one lab Neuro 239 AL or BL.
Prerequisite: Completion of Bio 125 or CH/BI 127.
prerequisites: Biology 125 or Integrated Chemistry/Biology 127. Offered annually, usually in the spring semester.
